item.title: About
item.description: PathPearls Source of practical pearls from the literature for anatomical & clinical pathologists in practice or in preparation for board exams Author & Creator: Rachel Jug Anatomical & Clinical Pathologist specialized in Cytopathology & Transfusion Medicine Trained at RCSI, Duke, and University of Toronto (current)

item.title: COVID-19 & Pregnancy
item.description: COVID-19 Updates RE: Pregnancy I have a lot pregnant friends and family members right now so Archives' latest slew of articles on the effects of COVID-19 on pregnant women and their infants particularly piqued my interest. Here are a few poignant pearls I took away: Coronaviruses in Pregnancy - Analysis of 38 women with COVID-19 and review of prior coronaviruses' impacts on pregnancy SARS-CoV1 25% fatality rate in pregnant women Complications to fetus: miscarriage, intrauterine growth restriction, preterm birth No vertical transmission MERS
